intro: Trichosanthes sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak snake gourd, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, pumpkins, and gourds. The plant produces elongated, pale green fruits with a distinctive warty texture. Its leaves are broad and lobed, and it flowers with yellow petals and a prominent, fleshy stamen. The fruit is edible when mature, though it is typically used in traditional medicine and local cuisines.
